BasicDescription.Title: Book Of The Week
BasicDescription.Synopsis: My Life As Me: Barry Humphries casts off his Dame Edna Everage mantle to read from his hilarious autobiography in his own voice. He recalls his early days in Melbourne. .

BasicDescription.Title: The Archers
BasicDescription.Synopsis: David's mission is successful.

BasicDescription.Title: Case Notes
BasicDescription.Synopsis: A guide to your back and how to look after it. Why are we getting so much back pain, what can we do to protect our backs, and how can the health professionals help?

BasicDescription.Title: Midnight News
BasicDescription.Synopsis: The latest national and international news from BBC Radio 4.

BasicDescription.Title: Shipping Forecast
BasicDescription.Synopsis: The latest Shipping Forecast.

BasicDescription.Title: As BBC World Service
BasicDescription.Synopsis: BBC Radio 4 joins the BBC World Service for a selection of news and current affairs, arts and science programmes. BBC Radio 4 resumes at 5.35am.

BasicDescription.Title: Radio 4 Open Up
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Includes a News Summary, the latest Shipping and Inshore Waters forecasts, and Prayer For The Day with the Reverend Elfed ap Nefydd Roberts.

BasicDescription.Title: Farming Today
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Agricultural news and features with Sarah Mukherjee.

BasicDescription.Title: Today
BasicDescription.Synopsis: With John Humphrys and James Naughtie. Includes Sports Desk at 6.25am, 7.25am and 8.25am; Weather at 6.55am and 7.55am; Thought For The Day at 7.45am. Yesterday In Parliament at 6.45am.

BasicDescription.Title: Midweek
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Libby Purves and guests engage in lively and diverse conversation.

BasicDescription.Title: Book Of The Week
BasicDescription.Synopsis: My Life As Me: Barry Humphries casts off his Dame Edna Everage mantle to read from his hilarious autobiography in his own voice. He recalls his early days in Melbourne. .

BasicDescription.Title: Woman's Hour
BasicDescription.Synopsis: With Jenni Murray. Includes at 10.45am the drama Live Alone And Like It by Marjorie Hillis. How does a girl get rid of a chap in the early hours?

With Jenni Murray. Includes at 10.45am the drama Live Alone And Like It by Marjorie Hillis, dramatised by Mary Cutler.
Frank is a fairly biddable old thing, thank heavens. But how does a girl get rid of a chap in the early hours? Especially if she would like him to come back again.
When it was published in 1935, Live Alone And Like It rapidly became a best-seller both here and in America. With chapter headings like Solitary Refinement; Your Leisure - If Any; Pleasures Of A Single Bed; Will You Or Won't You? and A Lady And Her Liquor, it covered every aspect of the single life. So get out your best bedjacket, and lie back and enjoy Mary Cutler's hilarious and imaginative account.
Marjorie ...... Serena Evans Judith ...... Celia Imrie Sylvia ...... Haydn Gwynne Frank ...... Robert Daws Miss Stark ...... Alison Carney

BasicDescription.Title: A Class Act
BasicDescription.Synopsis: The first in a new series charting a brave experiment in secondary education - the launch of a new school on the site of what was one of the country's most notorious comprehensives.

The first in a new series charting a brave experiment in secondary education - the launch of a new school on the site of what was one of the country's most notorious comprehensives.
Previous programmes followed the original intake of 180 eleven year olds over the first year of the new venture. Now we re-join them as they prepare for the Sats exams that will help determine whether or not the school is succeeding.

BasicDescription.Title: The Matchmaker
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Written by the late John B. Keane, Tony Award winning play The Matchmaker is a collection of dramatised letters between a matchmaker in rural Ireland and his lonely-hearted clients.

Written by the late John B Keane, The Matchmaker is a collection of dramatised letters - resonant with wit, mischief, pain and pathos - between a matchmaker in rural Ireland and his lonely-hearted clients.
In this first episode we meet Richard Michael O'Connor, otherwise known as Dickie Mick Dickie, our Matchmaker, and eavesdrop on his daily correspondence, including letters to the fearsome Fionulla Crust, who is desperate to be rid of her unsatisfying husband, and the Honourable Claude Glynn Hunter, who is equally desperate to be wed.
Recorded at the Siamsa Tire Theatre in Tralee, Ireland, an all star cast perform this timeless and hilarious three part serialised version of the Tony Award winning play.
Cast includes:
Anna Manahan Des Keogh Niall Toibin [Ballykissangel] Pauline McLynn [Father Ted] David Kelly [Waking Ned] Jeananne Crowley [Educating Rita]

BasicDescription.Title: News
BasicDescription.Synopsis: The latest national and international news headlines from BBC Radio 4.

BasicDescription.Title: You And Yours
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Consumer news and discussion with Liz Barclay and John Waite.

BasicDescription.Title: The World At One
BasicDescription.Synopsis: National and international news from BBC Radio 4. With reports from our correspondents worldwide. Presented by Nick Clarke.

BasicDescription.Title: Wireless Wise
BasicDescription.Synopsis: David Hatch chairs the radio quiz about radio - this week Nick Clarke and Natalie Wheen battle against Phill Jupitus and Johnny Walker.

BasicDescription.Title: Afternoon Play
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Written To Death: A darkly comic tale of middle aged and recently widowed Ellen who finds joining a writing group provides greater solace than punching cushions. Stars Sheila Donald.

Written To Death
A darkly comic tale of middle aged and recently widowed Ellen who finds joining a writing group provides greater solace than punching cushions but discovers that ficton can be more revealing than she intends.
Ellen/Edie ...... Sheila Donald Beryl/Louise ...... Sarah Collier Huber ...... Crawford Logan Reg ...... Robin Thomson Dan ...... Chris Delaney Daphne ...... Lucy Paterson
Directed by Dave Batchelor.

BasicDescription.Title: Gardeners' Question Time
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Eric Robson chairs the popular horticultural forum. Matthew Biggs, John Cushnie and Roy Lancaster answer questions posed by gardeners in West Yorkshire.

BasicDescription.Title: Love And Loss
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Tracking Station: By Amanda Smyth. Five stories of the bitterness of love. Three into two doesn't go. A young girl is the odd one out in a night at a secret hideaway.

BasicDescription.Title: Blood Chronicles
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Blood War: Graeme Garden explores how blood has been used in times of war and how it became a central part of the nation's medical care.

BasicDescription.Title: Thinking Allowed
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Find out what the Russian youth think of Western Culture and why they have no intention of exporting their own.

BasicDescription.Title: PM
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Full coverage and analysis of the day's news, plus the sports headlines. Presented by Clare English and Eddie Mair.

BasicDescription.Title: Six O'Clock News
BasicDescription.Synopsis: The latest national and international news from BBC Radio 4.

BasicDescription.Title: Meet Mr Mulliner
BasicDescription.Synopsis: A Slice Of Life: Dramatised by Roger Davenport. PG Wodehouse's teller of tales, Mr Mulliner, played by Richard Griffiths tells a story of gothic comedy and a determined suitor.

A Slice Of Life
Dramatised by Roger Davenport
Starring Richard Griffiths
PG Wodehouse's fabled teller of tales, Mr Mulliner, regularly drops into the Angler's Rest public house for a hot whisky, and is inevitably moved to tell the regulars another story of the carryings-on of his much extended family.
In Roger Davenport's adroit radio dramatisations, the regulars at the pub are drawn into the tales to become the characters of the stories with the barmaid, Miss Postlethwaite, regularly translated into the ingenues of the tales.
A Slice Of Life is a gothic comedy of beauty preparations, thwarted love, a spooky old house, and a determined suitor. Wilfred, a young inventor of the Mulliner family dynasty, wins the love of a young heiress, then has to disguise himself as a valet to rescue her from her suspected imprisonment in a country mansion. But what role has his invention played in her ordeal?
Matilda Ziegler ...... Miss Postlethwaite/Angela Tom George ...... Wilfred Mulliner Peter Acre ...... Dr Brady Martin Hyder ...... McKinnon David Timpson ...... Colonel Cartaret Richard Griffiths ...... Mr Mulliner.
The director is Ned Chaillet.

BasicDescription.Title: The Archers
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Kenton's stuck in the mud.

BasicDescription.Title: Front Row
BasicDescription.Synopsis: The arts programme with Mark Lawson, including a review of the new Woody Allen film The Curse Of The Jade Scorpion set in 1940s New York.

BasicDescription.Title: Live Alone And Like It
BasicDescription.Synopsis: By Marjorie Hillis, dramatised by Mary Cutler. How does a girl get rid of a chap in the early hours? Published in 1935 it is still a valid comment on single life.

By Marjorie Hillis, dramatised by Mary Cutler.
Frank is a fairly biddable old thing, thank heavens. But how does a girl get rid of a chap in the early hours? Especially if she would like him to come back again.

BasicDescription.Title: The Moral Maze
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Michael Buerk chairs a debate on the moral questions behind the week's news. Steven Rose, Claire Fox, Michael Gove and Melanie Phillips cross-examine witnesses.

BasicDescription.Title: In The Think Tanks
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Dennis Sewell visits leading think tanks in London and Washington to find out what makes the policy wonks tick.

BasicDescription.Title: The Serendipity Of Science
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Going With A Bang!: Taking a look at the lucky accidents behind a surprising number of scientific breakthroughs. Simon Singh learns about microexplosives and mysterious craters.

Going With A Bang!
A look at the lucky accidents behind a surprising number of scientific breakthroughs. Simon Singh learns about some explosive discoveries - a mysterious crater off the coast of Norway and a microexplosive made from silicon chips.

BasicDescription.Title: The World Tonight
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Analysis of the day's national and international stories, including interviews with politicians and public figures. With Robin Lustig.

BasicDescription.Title: Book At Bedtime
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Tiger In The Smoke: By Margery Allingham. Read by Anton Lessor. Tonight as the smog oozes over London, there is murder in the air and a new sense of menace abroad.

BasicDescription.Title: The Best A Man Can Get
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Continuing comedy drama, starring Mark Heap as Michael, a new Dad who escapes from the exhausting misery of babies by leading a secret double life. Adapted from John O'Farrell's best selling novel.

Continuing comedy drama, starring Mark Heap as Michael, a new Dad who escapes from the exhausting misery of babies by leading a secret double life. Adapted from John O'Farrell's best selling novel.
Michael/Narrator ...... Mark Heap Catherine ...... Tamsin Greig Jim ...... Dan Chambers Millie ...... Mabel Hoskins Simon ...... Mark Huckerby Kate ...... Emma Kennedy Paul ...... Nick Ostler Dad ...... Roger Sloman
Written and adapted by John O'Farrell.

BasicDescription.Title: Today In Parliament
BasicDescription.Synopsis: A review of the day's events in Parliament.
